meanings.sent1: She is the stubbornest person I know, always refusing to change her mind.
meanings.sent2: The mule was the stubbornest animal on the farm, never listening to commands.
meanings.sent3: Even the stubbornest donkey would have given in to her persistence.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornest refusal to compromise led to the downfall of the project.
meanings.sent5: The stubbornest oak tree stood tall against the strongest winds.

meanings.definition: Most difficult to move or change
meanings.sent1: The boulder was the stubbornest obstacle in our path, impossible to budge.
meanings.sent2: The old rusted door was the stubbornest thing to open, requiring all our strength.
meanings.sent3: Trying to convince the stubbornest vending machine to accept the wrinkled dollar was a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The stubbornest knot in the rope refused to come undone, causing frustration.
meanings.sent5: The stubbornest stain on the carpet resisted all cleaning efforts.

meanings.definition: Most resistant to persuasion or advice
meanings.sent1: He was the stubbornest student in the class, never willing to consider different viewpoints.
meanings.sent2: The cat was the stubbornest pet, ignoring all attempts to train it.
meanings.sent3: The stubbornest umbrella refused to open despite the pouring rain.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornest belief in superstitions made her avoid walking under ladders.
meanings.sent5: The stubbornest child in the family always insisted on having the last word.
